About the Role


	We are seeking a strategic, highly organized, and proactive Executive Assistant to support the Chief Operations Officer (COO) in driving operational excellence across the organization.
	This is not a traditional administrative role&mdash;it is a leadership support position requiring strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
	The ideal candidate will act as a trusted partner, ensuring smooth operations and enabling the COO to focus on high-impact priorities.


Key Responsibilities


	Operational Oversight: Coordinate and monitor key operational initiatives, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
	Project Management: Lead and track special projects, prepare reports, and manage timelines to deliver results.
	Data Analysis &amp; Reporting: Collect, analyze, and present operational data to support decision-making.
	Executive Support: Manage complex calendars, prioritize meetings, and handle confidential communications.
	Stakeholder Coordination: Serve as liaison between the COO, internal teams, and external partners.
	Process Optimization: Identify inefficiencies and implement solutions to streamline workflows.
	Documentation &amp; Communication: Draft presentations, reports, and correspondence with clarity and precision.

	Education: Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Management, or related field (Master&rsquo;s preferred).

	Excellent written and verbal communication
	High level of discretion and integrity
	Preferred: Experience in health services or consulting environments.


Why Join Us?


	Opportunity to work closely with senior leadership and influence organizational success.
	Dynamic, fast-paced environment with room for growth.
	Collaborative culture focused on innovation and impact.

Executive Assistant to the COO Job at HSCL Group




        
    

        
        HSCL is a public health and development consulting firm, with extensive experience in Health Systems Strengthening, International Health and Development Programs Design and Implementation. We provide sustainable solutions for a broad spectrum of health and other international development challenges.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the COO

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-Time

About the Role

	We are seeking a strategic, highly organized, and proactive Executive Assistant to support the Chief Operations Officer (COO) in driving operational excellence across the organization.
	This is not a traditional administrative role—it is a leadership support position requiring strong analytical, project management, and communication skills.
	The ideal candidate will act as a trusted partner, ensuring smooth operations and enabling the COO to focus on high-impact priorities.


Key Responsibilities


	Operational Oversight: Coordinate and monitor key operational initiatives, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
	Project Management: Lead and track special projects, prepare reports, and manage timelines to deliver results.
	Data Analysis & Reporting: Collect, analyze, and present operational data to support decision-making.
	Executive Support: Manage complex calendars, prioritize meetings, and handle confidential communications.
	Stakeholder Coordination: Serve as liaison between the COO, internal teams, and external partners.
	Process Optimization: Identify inefficiencies and implement solutions to streamline workflows.
	Documentation & Communication: Draft presentations, reports, and correspondence with clarity and precision.


Qualifications & Skills


	Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, or related field (Master’s preferred).
	Experience: 5+ years of supporting senior executives, ideally in operations or project management.
	Core Competencies: 
	Leadership and strategic thinking
	Advanced organizational and time management skills
	Strong analytical and data interpretation abilities
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite and project management tools (e.g., Asana, Trello)
	Excellent written and verbal communication
	High level of discretion and integrity
	Preferred: Experience in health services or consulting environments.


Why Join Us?


	Opportunity to work closely with senior leadership and influence organizational success.
	Dynamic, fast-paced environment with room for growth.
	Collaborative culture focused on innovation and impact.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application including a prepared single PDF document containing their Cover Letter (no more than one page) and updated CV to: recruitment@hscgroup.org using “Executive Assistant – [Your Name]” as the subject of the email.
